The date and/or time of the formal or statistical admission to the institution.

node.description: The reason why the individual was admitted for an episode of care.
The type of admission.
The type of residence where the individual resided prior to admission.
The unstructured name or label for the organisation.
Additional narrative about the organisation not captured in other fields.
An entity comprising one or more people and having a particular purpose.
infection
Additional narrative about the episode, not captured in other fields.

Administrative details about a period of admitted patient care between a formal or statistical admission and a formal or statistical separation, characterised by only one care type of care from a healthcare institution.
Narrative description of the story or clinical history for the subject of care.
The subjective clinical history of the subject of care as recorded directly by the subject, or reported to a clinician by the subject or a carer.
The measured temperature.
A measurement of the body temperature, which is a surrogate for the core body temperature of the individual.
The rate of the pulse or heart beat, measured in beats per minute.
The rate and associated attributes for a pulse or heart beat.
Minimum systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in the diastolic or relaxation phase of the heart cycle.
Peak systemic arterial blood pressure  - measured in systolic or contraction phase of the heart cycle.
The local measurement of arterial blood pressure which is a surrogate for arterial pressure in the systemic circulation.
The frequency of spontaneous breathing.
The characteristics of spontaneous breathing by an individual.
The saturation of oxygen in the peripheral blood, measured via pulse oximetry.
The saturation of carboxyhaemoglobin in the peripheral blood, measured via pulse CO-oximetry.
Blood oxygen and related measurements, measured by pulse oximetry or pulse CO-oximetry.
Framework for consistent modelling of observations and measurements about essential physiological functions.
The weight of the individual.
Measurement of the body weight of an individual.
The length of the body from crown of head to sole of foot.
Height, or body length, is measured from crown of head to sole of foot.
Index describing ratio of weight to height.
Calculated measurement which compares a persons weight and height.
The measurement of the longest distance around the head.
The measurement of the longest distance around the head.
Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
